intro: Lappa zalewski, commonly known as the water lappa, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in wet or marshy habitats, often found near water bodies. Its botanical features make it an important species in wetland ecosystems.
